intro: Lingoum oblongum, commonly known as the broadleaf lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Parmeliaceae. It is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is flat and leaf-like in appearance. The plant typically grows on bark, stone, or soil in temperate and boreal forests. Its color ranges from pale green to yellowish-green, and it often has a distinctive pattern of soredia on its surface. Lingoum oblongum plays an important role in ecological systems by contributing to soil formation and serving as a food source for various invertebrates.
